name: Russian Cheese Pancakes (Syrniki)
author: Anonymous
summary: Syrniki are traditional pancakes from Russia and usually served for breakfast with jam or sour cream. The cheese used to make them is called tvorog, the closest in the US would be farmer's cheese or quark.
ingredients: 5 tablespoons all-purpose flour, plus extra for dusting
directions: Beat egg and white sugar together in a bowl until smooth
Whisk in quark cheese, flour, vanilla sugar, and salt
Mix well until dough is thick and sticky
Form into balls and coat with some flour
Flatten slightly to form into discs (syrniki)
Heat oil in skillet over medium-low heat
Add the syrniki; fry until browned, 5 minutes per side
